refnamediv.refpurpose: A list-like data structure that can be used with the GtkTreeView

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkListStore implements GtkTreeModel, GtkTreeDragSource, GtkTreeDragDest and GtkTreeSortable.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkListStore object is a list model for use with a GtkTreeView widget. It implements the GtkTreeModel interface, and consequentialy, can use all of the methods available there. It also implements the GtkTreeSortable interface so it can be sorted by the view. Finally, it also implements the tree drag and drop interfaces.

The GtkListStore can accept most GObject types as a column type, though it can't accept all custom types. Internally, it will keep a copy of data passed in (such as a string or a boxed pointer). Columns that accept GObjects are handled a little differently. The GtkListStore will keep a reference to the object instead of copying the value. As a result, if the object is modified, it is up to the application writer to call gtk_tree_model_row_changed to emit the "row_changed" signal. This most commonly effects lists with GdkPixbufs stored.

example.title: Creating a simple list store.

refsect2.title: Performance Considerations
refsect2.para: Internally, the GtkListStore is implemented with a linked list with a tail pointer. As a result, it is fast at data insertion and deletion, and not as fast at random data access. The GtkListStore sets the GTK_TREE_MODEL_ITERS_PERSIST flag, which means that GtkTreeIters can be cached while the row exists. Thus, if access to a particular row is needed often, it is worth keeping the iter around.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new list store as with n_columns columns each of the types passed in. Note that only types derived from standard GObject fundamental types are supported.
As an example, gtk_tree_store_new (3, G_TYPE_INT, G_TYPE_STRING, GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF); will create a new GtkListStore with three columns, of type int, string and GdkPixbuf respectively.

listitem.simpara: number of columns in the list store
all GType types for the columns, from first to last

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_newv ()
refsect2.para: Non-vararg creation function. Used primarily by language bindings.

listitem.simpara: number of columns in the list store
an array of GType types for the columns, from first to last

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_set_column_types ()
refsect2.para: This function is meant primarily for GObjects that inherit from GtkListStore, and should only be used when constructing a new GtkListStore. It will not function after a row has been added, or a method on the GtkTreeModel interface is called.

listitem.simpara: Number of columns for the list store
An array length n of GTypes

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_set ()
refsect2.para: Sets the value of one or more cells in the row referenced by iter. The variable argument list should contain integer column numbers, each column number followed by the value to be set. The list is terminated by a -1. For example, to set column 0 with type G_TYPE_STRING to "Foo", you would write gtk_list_store_set (store, iter, 0, "Foo", -1).

listitem.simpara: pairs of column number and value, terminated with -1

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_set_valist ()
refsect2.para: See gtk_list_store_set(); this version takes a va_list for use by language bindings.

listitem.simpara: A valid GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_set_value ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_list_store_set_value (GtkListStore *list_store, GtkTreeIter *iter, gint column, GValue *value);
refsect2.para: Sets the data in the cell specified by iter and column. The type of value must be convertible to the type of the column.

listitem.simpara: A valid GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the given row from the list store. After being removed, iter is set to be the next valid row, or invalidated if it pointed to the last row in list_store.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if iter is valid, FALSE if not.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_insert ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new row at position. iter will be changed to point to this new row. If position is larger than the number of rows on the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be empty before this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

listitem.simpara: An unset GtkTreeIter to set to the new row
position to insert the new row

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_insert_before ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new row before sibling. If sibling is NULL, then the row will be appended to the end of the list. iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty before this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

listitem.simpara: An unset GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_insert_after ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new row after sibling. If sibling is NULL, then the row will be prepended to the beginning of the list. iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

listitem.simpara: An unset GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Prepends a new row to list_store. iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

listitem.simpara: An unset GtkTreeIter to set to the prepend row

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_append ()
refsect2.para: Appends a new row to list_store. iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

listitem.simpara: An unset GtkTreeIter to set to the appended row

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_clear ()
refsect2.para: Removes all rows from the list store.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_iter_is_valid ()
refsect2.para: WARNING: This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing purposes.
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this GtkListStore.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the iter is valid, FALSE if the iter is invalid.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_reorder ()
refsect2.para: Reorders store to follow the order indicated by new_order. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.

listitem.simpara: an array of integers mapping the new position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. new_order[newpos] = oldpos.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_swap ()
refsect2.para: Swaps a and b in store. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.
Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_move_before ()
refsect2.para: Moves iter in store to the position before position. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If position is NULL, iter will be moved to the end of the list.
Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_list_store_move_after ()
refsect2.para: Moves iter in store to the position after position. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If position is NULL, iter will be moved to the start of the list.
Since 2.2
